definition: To surprise someone very much; to fill with wonder.
examples: The magician’s tricks amazed the crowd.
It never ceases to amaze me how fast plants grow.

definition: Very cold; relating to the regions around the North Pole; the Arctic region.
examples: Penguins live in Antarctic regions, although the Arctic is also extremely cold. (adjective)
Sea ice covers much of the Arctic in winter. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Arctic = think ‘ice and aurora’ at the top of the world.

definition: A place where legal cases are heard or a marked area for games; to try to win favour or to risk bringing about something.
examples: The case will go to court next month. (noun)
They played tennis on the new court. (noun)
He courted disaster by driving too fast. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Court can be a law room, a sports room, or the act of seeking favour.

definition: To choose by voting; chosen but not yet in office.
examples: Citizens will elect a new council on Friday. (verb)
The president-elect will take office in January. (adjective)

definition: A pause or break in activity; the time or distance between two points or events.
examples: We bought snacks during the interval at the theatre.
Trains arrive at ten-minute intervals.

definition: A group of teams that compete against each other; also a long-distance measure used in the past.
examples: Her team won the football league this year.
Sailors once measured journeys in leagues.

extra.memory_tip: League = linked teams in a season.

definition: A point beyond which something cannot go; to set a maximum or restrict.
examples: Please keep under the speed limit. (noun)
We must limit screen time in the evening. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Limit = line in it—don’t cross the line.

definition: An important event or stage in development or progress.
examples: Learning to read is a major milestone for children.
The company marked a milestone of one million users.

extra.memory_tip: Milestone = a stone that marks how far you’ve come.

definition: Activities done for enjoyment and relaxation when not working.
examples: Swimming is popular recreation in summer.
The park was built for community recreation.

extra.memory_tip: Re-creation = creating your energy again by resting and playing.

definition: To deal with a task or person directly; in sport, to stop an opponent by grabbing or knocking; the equipment used for a particular activity.
examples: We’ll tackle the hardest question first. (verb)
His last-minute tackle saved a goal. (noun)

extra.memory_tip: Tackle = take hold of the problem—or the player.
